name: Holiday Inn Express Montreal Centre-Ville

reviews.text: I had a marvelous stay at this downtown Montreal hotel. it is within 3 minutes walking distance of both the old city and Chinatown. The hotel staff was amazing and everythinig was clean and comfortable. I would definately return.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff and location

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel this week for a few nights and it was great. David the Sales Manager at the hotel went above and beyond to make sure my stay went well. I highly recommend Holiday Inn Express over any other holiday inn's downtown Montreal. I use to stay all the time at another Holiday Inn property with close to 500 rooms located downtown and i will never stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Best Holiday Inn in Montreal

reviews.text: The rooms are huge and clean. Breakfast is wonderful and staff very friendly.
reviews.title: Just average...

reviews.text: Needs a renovation. antiquated rooms. good location. Decent price.
reviews.title: Was good 5 years ago but....

reviews.text: Wouldnt stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value and very good service with a smile
Cleaning staff absent on weekends
reviews.text: First, the hotel is as many others say, a decent 3 star HIE with same typical breakfast, good size rooms and very nice and accommodating front desk staff. I'm actually writing this review in support of them and their efforts to fix what is wrong behind the scenes. Checked in very late on Thursday for a 4 night stay. Night manager was wonderful and changed my room when I discovered they had given me a smoking room. Friday, cleaning staff did a lovely job however, I had no cleaning either Sat or Sun even after I told the front desk on Sat no cleaning so imagine my surprise when I didn't get any cleaning the next day as well. Good thing i brought my own toiletries. Perhaps staff are reporting " do not disturb" when no such door hanger was posted? Just a thought. Again front desk tried to help me and did give a 15 dollar credit per night ( is that all cleaning is worth ... I spoke to others staying at the hotel and they also mentioned rooms not cleaned on the weekend.

reviews.title: old hotel with issues
reviews.text: I'm not a picky person at all when it comes to hotels but this hotel is worn. Stains on carpets. Was missing a shower curtain upon arrival. The toilet overflowed. I know these things happen but it was how the issue was handled that was the problem. I called the front desk 3 times to fix the toilet and no one came up. Put a service request on my door--no response. Sent an email to the hotel without a response to date. Could not use the toilet for most of our stay.
Issue was finally resolved at 11pm. I will never stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Better than expected ...
Filthy, dirty..
reviews.text: Stayed in the two bedroom suite with my girl friends for the weekend of May 11th/2012. Check-in was fast, efficient, friendly, and fun thanks to Ricky at the front desk! Our room was ready at 1pm which was a pleasant surprise after such a long train ride.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was surprisingly big with two queen bedroom suites, large bathroom, living room area with pull-out couch, and a full kitchenette. Loved that the windows opened for fresh air! The carpets could use a little freshening up, and the bathroom is getting a bit warn out, but these things were easily over looked. The linens and beds were so clean, fresh and comfortable, and that's the main thing for us. Most of our time was spent enjoying down town Montreal, not sitting in our hotel room stewing over little things.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: booked our 4-night stay through Montreal Tourism website, sweat deal offer (50% off every second night). Entered 2 adults and 2 kids, and the rates displayed, and the order the rates were displayed, and the remark on the website all happening only with that specific hotel on the website lead me to expect different rates than what the hotel told me at check-in. After long conversations with Tourism Montreal and the Hotel, no one was able to explain why the site did that and displayed different numbers than what the hotel received, and in a different order. I had a choice of go somewhere else or take the hotel's manager offer which ended up higher than what I expected.
reviews.title: wont happen again

reviews.text: What disappointed me even more was that I realized later that what the manager gave me and called a discount was actually another correction since the site gave me a 4-adults rate instead 2, but she insisted she would base the 50% off of the rate before the $20 discount as some kind of "count your blessings". Later I figured out the fact that the $20 was actually a correction, and then what she did was simply taking advantage of me not knowing that and charged me $10 more on the discounted nights. Now $10 is not much and am not fussing about them, but it only showed me a dishonest move from a manager of a big name hotel, and for how much? $10? off a 4 night stay of almost $500 in total ?
reviews.title: Great Value!! Excellent Place for Groups...
Great Value
reviews.text: Escalated issue to head office, and later got the message clear saying it is a franchise business and head office has no control whatsoever on rates.
Aside from that :
reviews.title: Great spot for a family

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Good for the money

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and was very happy with it. It was a little outside of the city centre, but I didn't mind the walk and found that the free breakfasts made it well worth it. I typically prefer suite-style hotels when I'm travelling for a few days and definitely made use of the fridge, microwave, and kettle. There was even a dishwasher, but I didn't find it necessary.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. My one complaint would be the internet connection, which was not very strong or reliable. I found that the wireless was much better though, so it wasn't really an issue. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.. or sometimes a little less!

reviews.text: Stayed here September 2011, was in Montreal with a friend for 3 days of shopping and partying. This hotel was an average priced hotel, I knew what to expect as I read reviews before booking.. It is out dated and a bit dirty looking. Would have been happier if I paid a bit less though.
reviews.title: Good worth for money

reviews.text: The kitchenette was nice, with a separate room for the bed, but the couch looked like it was from the 90's and had lots of random stains. There was only 2 of each utensil in the cupboard, and no dish soap - so if you plan on using the dishes, bring soap.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was small and not too much there unless you like cereal, toast, yogurt and fruit - which was fine for us.
reviews.title: Way below average

Perfect for those staying on business, our hotel in Montreal offers a well-equipped business centre, high-speed Internet and close proximity to Montreal Convention Center, Bombardier, CBC, Deloitte and Touche, Hydro Quebec, KPMG, SNC Lavalin, Complexe Desjardins and Guy Favreau, Place des Arts, UQAM & McGill University. Because we have a better location than most hotels, our Montreal, Canada lodging is the perfect place for families to stay during their vacation. We're situated near historic Old Montreal, Chinatown, Six Flags A La Ronde amusement park, Bell Centre, Grand Prix Du Canada, the Casino and many of Montreal's finest restaurants, museums and shopping. If you're looking for quality Montreal hotels & convenient services, then look no further. The Holiday Inn Express is the perfect place to stay during your next vacation.
